Special effects are actually visual tricks used in the film, television, etc. to simulate the imagination of the virtual world. Special effects are divided into two categories: Mechanical effects and Visual effects. Alzahravfx is one of the leading studios in producing special visual effects.

Special effects, types and introduction to Alzahravfx studio

What are the special effects?

Cinema has always been one of the most influential and popular media in the world. Special effects are one of the factors that have led the scriptwriters and directors to convey their stories and thoughts to the audience, much easier than what writers do. In recent years, special effects- which has been at the service of filmmakers since the beginning of film history- have become an inseparable part of cinema. To the extent that many of the best films could not have been made without the use of special effects or didn’t have the intended effect on the audience. Special effects are actually visual tricks used in the theater, film, television, video games, etc. to simulate the imagination of the virtual world.


Special effects

<YouTube youTubeId="Q-J6B3ib_uc"/>

Types of special effects

Special effects are traditionally divided into two categories:

Mechanical effects
Visual effects (abbreviated VFX)
Mechanical effects are usually done during live recording. The techniques are done realistically and are executed by cameramen, Stunt performer and explosives specialists and recorded by cameras.

Visual effects in filmmaking industry are the process to create or manipulate different images. The visual effects are actually a combination of real and unrealistic images. The reason for using this kind of special effects is that in many films, making the actual environment seem impractical, expensive and dangerous. Nowadays these images are created using animation software and computer simulation.

Alzahravfx is not affiliated with any particular political party. This studio is only set up to build impressive projects to explain the goals of the Islamic Revolution

Special effects of Murphy’s Law movie

Murphy’s Law was directed by Rambod Javan in 1398. Alzahravfx is proud to have produced visual effects for this feature film and also custom projects. The car crashed through the glass into a crowded enclosure, the car overturns with watermelons, and the shotgun scene are among of scenes featuring visual effects in the film, produced by Alzahravfx
